required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Releasing of Inflammatory Mediators During Retreatment of Root Canals
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Different File Systems Used in Retreatment on the Release of Inflammatory Mediators

brief_summary.textblock: Nonsurgical root canal retreatment may become essential when the initial endodontic treatment fails because of the persistent intracanal or extracanal infections.The aim of this thesis study is to evaluate the effect of ProTaper Universal Retreatment (PTUR), Reciproc blue and XP-endo Finisher R file systems, which are used in the removal of root canal filling materials during retreatment with different motion kinetics on the release of Substance P, Calcitonin Gene-Related Peptide (CGRP), IL-6 and IL-10 inflammatory mediators in the periapical region

detailed_description.textblock: Seventy-five individuals with asymptomatic and chronic apical periodontitis teeth with retreatment indication were included in the study. Individuals were randomly divided into three groups according to the file system used to remove root canal filling materials (n = 25): ProTaper Universal Retreatment, Reciproc blue and XP-endo Finisher R.After the removal of the previous root canal filling materials, reshaping and disinfection of the root canals, periapical fluid samples were taken from the root tip of the teeth in all three groups. The amount of Substance P, CGRP, IL-6 and IL-10 mediators that cause pain, swelling and flare-up in periapical fluid samples were measured by ELISA test.

primary_outcome.description: The samples were collected from periapical exudate at the end of the root canal retreatment procedure. The samples were analyzed with ELISA method and change of inflammatory mediator levels were evaluated in pg/ml.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Retreatment system using in rotational motion
arm_group.description: Previous root canal filling materials were removed with D1-D2-D3 retreatment files with using an endodontic motor in rotational motion

arm_group.arm_group_label: Retreatment system using in reciprocal motion
arm_group.description: Previous root canal filling materials were removed with Reciproc 25 file with using an endodontic motor in reciprocal motion

arm_group.arm_group_label: Retreatment system using in additional rotational motion
arm_group.description: Previous root canal filling materials were removed with XP-endo finisher r file with using an endodontic motor in rotational motion

intervention.description: D1-D2-D3 Retreatment files were used in 500 rpm and 3 Ncm with X-Smart endomotor
intervention.arm_group_label: Retreatment system using in rotational motion

intervention.description: R25 retratment files were used with X-Smart endomotor in reciprocal motion
intervention.arm_group_label: Retreatment system using in reciprocal motion

intervention.description: XP-Endo finisher r file were used in 1000 rpm 1 Ncm with X-Smart endomotor
intervention.arm_group_label: Retreatment system using in additional rotational motion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who had single root canal treated teeth with chronic periapical lesion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are immunocompromised
- Patients under antibiotic or analgesic medication

facility.name: Faculty of Dentistry of Bulent Ecevit University
